artefact: Find out your National Insurance number if you've lost it

artefact.alternative_title: How to get your National Insurance number if you lose it
artefact.overview: What to do if you lose your National Insurance number, information about where to find it and who to contact
artefact.body:
You can find your National Insurance number on your payslip, P60 or tax return.

If you still can’t find it, you can either:

  • fill in form CA5403 – Your National Insurance number and send it to the address on the form
  • phone the National Insurance Registrations Helpline

National Insurance Registrations Helpline
0845 915 7006
Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 5pm

You don’t need a National Insurance plastic card as long as you remember your number. HMRC no longer sends these cards out.

You turned 16 and didn’t get a number

You should automatically get a National Insurance number just before your 16th birthday. If you didn’t and you’re under 20, phone the National Insurance Registrations Helpline on 0845 915 7006.
